full_summary:
Title: Request for Proposal: National Indigenous Housing Centre
Tender Reference Number: cb-622-55987652
Date Released: January 22, 2024
Tender Closing Date: March 4, 2024

Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation (CMHC) is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the establishment and operation of a National Indigenous Housing Centre (NIHC) to deliver funding under the Urban, Rural, and Northern Indigenous Housing Strategy. The goal of this project is to support Indigenous peoples in greatest need and narrow the gap between Indigenous and non-Indigenous peoples in core housing, as outlined in the RFP specifications.

This project is part of the Government of Canada's response to its commitment to implement an Urban, Rural, and Northern Indigenous Housing Strategy, as per Action Plan item 88 of the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples Act Action Plan 2023-2028.

The successful proponent will be required to provide proof of Indigenous certification in good standing by the contract execution date, in accordance with Part II Mandatory Criteria. This certification will serve as an assurance that the centre is Indigenous-led and reflects the Government of Canada's procurement strategy for Indigenous business.

Key Proposal Requirements:

* Demonstrate expertise and experience in providing Indigenous housing services.
* Show a clear understanding of the Urban, Rural, and Northern Indigenous Housing Strategy and its objectives.
* Outline a comprehensive plan for establishing and operating the NIHC, including governance, staffing, and budgeting.
* Provide a detailed proposal for the delivery of funding under the U.R.N. Indigenous Housing Strategy.
* Include a sunset clause in the agreement to reflect a term of eight (8) years.

Evaluation Criteria:
The proposals will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Respondent's capability to deliver on the objectives of the Urban, Rural, and Northern Indigenous Housing Strategy.
* Quality of the proposal, including the relevance and feasibility of the plan.
* Depth and clarity of the information provided.
* Demonstrated understanding of the requirements and objectives of the project.

Submission Requirements:
Electronic proposals must be submitted to the Government of Canada's Online Tendering System ( Gems Liquibase EG ) by 2:00 PM EST on March 4, 2024. Late submissions will not be accepted.

For more information, please contact Christine Brown, Contracting Authority, at (613) 748-2534 or ccbrown@cmhc-schl.gc.ca. Further details and documentation are available on the Canada Buy Service website.
